post_message: It was my privilege to call to order House Democrats' hearing on the Flint Water Crisis. In an American city, thousands and thousands of children have been drinking and bathing in poisonous water for more than a year. It was not an unavoidable natural disaster. It is a man-made catastrophe. Now, thousands of children are at risk of lifelong damage from lead exposure â€“ unless we help get them the care, attention and resources they need. We have a responsibility to help the people of Flint tell their story â€“ and to be sure that story is heard loud and clear in the halls of Congress. The story of Flint challenges the conscience of America. It holds lessons and warnings for communities across the country.
